Dear Mr. Dixon:
This letter is a follow-up to the Department’s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your facility on 04/07/2022. The purpose of this inspection was to determine
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and administrative rules for Court Operated
Residential Care Facility.
The violations that were found are:
R 400.10137 Grievance procedure.
(2) The grievance procedure shall be explained and made
available to residents and their parents.
Three of three current resident files reviewed did not contain documentation that the
grievance procedure was explained/provided to the residents and their parents.
R 400.10141 Resident records; maintenance.
(h) Program rules and disciplinary policy signed by resident.
Three of three current resident files reviewed did not contain documentation that the
full disciplinary policy was provided to residents.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  517-335-1980

R 400.10207 Admission physical examination; screening for
communicable disease.
(1) A detention or shelter care facility shall arrange for an
admission physical examination for each resident not later than
7 calendar days after admission.
One of three current resident files was observed to not have an admission physical
completed within 7 days after admission. The physical was completed three and a
half months prior to admission.
R 400.10507 Fire drills and telephone.
(1) There shall be quarterly emergency fire drills for each staff
shift. Two of the drills shall include evacuations, unless
approved by the department, in writing, as clinically
contraindicated. Where a facility has a 24-hour staff shift, the
emergency drills shall be conducted at different times of the day
and night. Written records shall be maintained for each drill and
shall indicate the date and time of the drill and, where
evacuation was a part of the drill, the approximate evacuation
time.
A review of the fire drill log found that drills were done quarterly and covered various
shifts, but did not cover each shift, each quarter.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
R 139(o)
The facility was advised to ensure that youth sign off on property inventory sheets
for new property brought in after admission. They have a form with a signature line
and need to ensure it’s used fully.
R 157
The facility was advised to obtain clear documentation of parental refusal of
vaccination/immunization for youth when applicable.
CONSULTATION:
R 113
The facility was advised to ensure applicants fully fill out the work history section of
their applications.
2

Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
A follow-up inspection may be made to verify compliance. Should the corrections not be
made in the specified time, it may be necessary to reevaluate the status of your certificate
of inspection.
The Department provides technical assistance to meet the licensing requirements and
consultation to improve services.
Please contact me with any questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need
to speak to someone immediately, please contact the local office at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
